title.native: イエスタデイをうたって

description:
A story of love and humanity, following four boys and girls trying to live their best lives through hardship and turmoil, in a small town on a private rail line just outside of Shinjuku. Minor misunderstandings lead to big complications, and their various feelings become entangled.

A story of daily life lived 49% looking back, 51% looking forward.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Konbini
tags.description: Predominantly features a convenience store.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Office
tags.description: Features people who work in a business office.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

title.native: イエスタデイをうたって
イエスタデイをうたってExtras

node.description: Kei Toume studied at the Tama Art University in Tokyo. Her first manga, Rokujou Gekijou, was published in Comic Burger magazine in 1992. The manga won her the Shiki prize in a contest held by Kodansha in 1993. A year later, her follow-up manga Mannequin also won a prize.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rato_00)

_Note: Not to be confused by CG Artist [Ryouta Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/236953/Ryouta-Itou) who is affiliated with OLM._
Affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/Doga-Kobo). Sparsely worked as a production assistant earlier in her career.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/東潤一)

Founder and representative director of Studio Easter.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1038952624)

Currently affiliated with [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/Yostar-Pictures). Previously affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/藤純) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujijunrox)

Primarily an artist and illustrator. In addition to listed works, has also provided ending illustrations for Rozen Maiden: Ouvertüre and Kurenai, as well as costume designs for Kurenai and character designs for the series' opening sequence.
